intro: Grammica obtusiflora, commonly known as the blunt-flowered grammica, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Grammica obtusiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
